Dialogue.content: Hi, I'm Amina El-Sayed. It's nice to meet you.
Hi Amina! It's great to meet you too. How are you feeling today?
I'm feeling a bit anxious, to be honest. The semester just started, and I'm already struggling.
I understand. Starting a new semester can be overwhelming. Can you tell me more about what's been bothering you?
Well, I had a rough experience in a group project recently. I found it hard to present my ideas, and I felt embarrassed afterward.
That sounds really tough. It's completely normal to feel anxious about public speaking. How has this incident affected you?
I've become more self-conscious in class discussions. I worry about participating now.
It's understandable to feel that way after a difficult experience. Have you noticed if this affects your overall participation in your classes?
Yes, I've been retreating more and avoiding group activities. I feel overshadowed by my classmates.
That isolation can make things harder. What do you think might help you feel more comfortable participating again?
I guess I just need to build some confidence back, but I'm not sure how to start.
One approach could be to practice speaking in smaller, less intimidating settings before engaging in larger discussions. Would that be something you'd consider?
Yes, that sounds less intimidating. I might try discussing topics with friends first.
That's a great idea! Also, remember that everyone has their own journey with public speaking. You're not alone in this.
Thank you, I appreciate your understanding. It's comforting to know I'm not the only one who struggles.
Absolutely! Let's follow up on this next week and see how things are going. How does that sound?
That sounds good! Thank you for your help today.
Hi, I'm back. This week has been pretty challenging.
Welcome back, Amina! What's been going on this week?
I attended a mid-term exam prep session with my classmates, but I couldn't bring myself to speak up. I felt really overshadowed.
I'm sorry to hear that. It can be difficult when you feel lesser in a group. How did that experience impact you?
It made me feel even more insecure about my ideas. I ended up saying nothing at all.
That sounds tough. Have you thought about why you might be feeling so inhibited in that setting?
I'm not sure, but I just feel inadequate compared to how easily others communicate.
That's understandable. A lot of people feel comparison can be discouraging. Maybe instead of comparing, you can focus on what you can contribute.
That makes sense, but it's hard when everyone else seems so confident.
Absolutely, that's a common feeling. Would it help to set a small goal for your next group session, like sharing at least one thought?
Yes, I think that could help. Having a goal might make me feel more committed to speaking up.
Great! Setting a clear and achievable goal can pave the way for more involvement. Let me know how that goes next time we meet.
I will! Thanks for encouraging me.
Hi, I'm back again. I'm still feeling pretty anxious.
Hi Amina! I'm glad you're here. What's been happening this week?
I missed a couple of opportunities to participate in class because of my fear of judgment. It's like my anxiety is just growing.
That sounds really difficult. Feeling stuck like that can be frustrating. What do you think is holding you back the most?
I think it's just my self-doubt. I feel isolated when I see others easily share their thoughts.
It's tough to feel isolated among peers. Have you considered reaching out to a classmate or friend for support?
I haven't tried that yet. I think I'm afraid they'll judge me or think I'm weak.
It's completely normal to feel that way, but remember that sharing your feelings might actually strengthen your connections with others.
That's a good point! I'll think about reaching out.
That's great! Also, don't forget that everyone has insecurities, even those who seem confident.
I appreciate you reminding me of that. Sometimes I forget I'm not alone in this.
Absolutely, Amina! You're not alone. We can work through these feelings together. Let's check in next week and see how things are progressing.
Hi, I'm back again. I went to counseling last week.
Hi Amina! I'm glad you came back. How did the session go?
It was a bit relieving to talk about my feelings, but I still feel uncertain about how to improve.
That's completely understandable. What specific worries are you facing right now?
I still feel unqualified in class and worry I won't make it through my degree.
It's normal to feel that way, especially in an academic environment. Have you thought of taking small steps towards improving your confidence?
I want to, but I'm just not sure where to start.
How about starting with setting a goal of speaking up in class just once a week? That's manageable, right?
Yes, that seems doable! I think that would help me improve over time.
Absolutely! Remember, each small step you take is progress. It might feel uncomfortable initially, but you can do it!
Thank you for the encouragement. It helps to have a plan.
You're welcome, Amina! Let's check in next time to celebrate your progress. You've got this!
